metadata.title: CVE-2023-52522 linux
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:  net: fix possible store tearing in neigh_periodic_work()  While looking at a related syzbot report involving neigh_periodic_work(), I found that I forgot to add an annotation when deleting an RCU protected item from a list.  Readers use rcu_deference(*np), we need to use either rcu_assign_pointer() or WRITE_ONCE() on writer side to prevent store tearing.  I use rcu_assign_pointer() to have lockdep support, this was the choice made in neigh_flush_dev().
